In baseball, an intentional base on balls, usually referred to as an intentional 
walk and denoted in baseball scorekeeping by IBB, is a walk issued to a batter by 
a pitcher with the intent of removing the batter's opportunity to swing at the 
pitched ball. A pitch that is intentionally thrown far outside the strike zone for this 
purpose ... as an intentional base on balls if and only if the final pitch thrown in 
the plate...
